reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: To ensure provision of quality care and prevention services for all people in Kenya with TB, leprosy and lung diseases

description.narrative: Kenya - Tuberculosis - Amref Health Africa - Amref Kenya. This program has the following goals: To accelerate the reduction of TB, Leprosy and lung disease burden through provision of people-centered, universally accessible, acceptable and affordable quality services in Kenya.. The objectives of this program are: Reduce new HIV infections by 75%. Reduce AIDS related mortality by 25%. Sustain the gains in the context of a newly devolved health system. Intensify efforts to find “missing” cases. Reduce transmission. Prevent active disease and morbidity. Enhance the quality of care for chronic lung diseases

title.narrative: KEN-T-AMREF Program Agreement
KEN-T-AMREF Grant Performance Report
KEN-T-AMREF Grant Performance Report
Outcome indicator for KEN-T-AMREF
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases

TB treatment coverage: Percentage of new and relapse cases that were notified and treated among the estimated number of incident TB cases in the same year (all form of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed)
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Treatment success rate - bacteriologically confirmed TB cases
Coverage / Output indicator for KEN-T-AMREF
Number of TB cases (all forms) notified among key affected populations/high risk groups
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – private/non-governmental facilities
HSS-Other 1: Number of functional Community Units
Percentage of notified TB cases, all forms, contributed by non-NTP providers - community referrals
Number of community based organizations that received a pre-defined package of training
DOTS-Other 1: Number (and percentage) of TB cases identified through tracing of contacts of smear positive cases
Number of notified TB cases (all forms) contributed by non-national TB program providers – community referrals
HSS-Other 2: Default rate among TB cases (all forms)
Impact indicator for KEN-T-AMREF
TB/HIV mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB mortality rate per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
TB prevalence rate per 100,000 population
